channel.title: Comments on: Find Out If You Are Using Deprecated Features In SQL Server 2008
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Maybe someone ran it ad-hoc FASTFIRSTROW instead of option (fast 1)
item.content:encoded: Maybe someone ran it ad-hoc FASTFIRSTROW instead of option (fast 1)

item.title: By: AaronBertrand
item.dc:creator: AaronBertrand
item.description: I don't use that proc in my code either, and I don't use replication or full text. Still curious that the counter is 90 rather than 4 or 1.
item.content:encoded: I don’t use that proc in my code either, and I don’t use replication or full text. Still curious that the counter is 90 rather than 4 or 1.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Aaron, don’t know, I just ran it again, same output on staging

on another box I also get these two

‘::’ function calling syntax
CREATE_DROP_DEFAULT

Maybe TEXTPTR doesn’t show up for me because sys.sp_MSfilterclause is not used in my code, what is this proc is it a replication or full text procedure?

item.title: By: AaronBertrand
item.dc:creator: AaronBertrand
item.content:encoded:
How did you not have any instances of TEXTPTR? This is used in at least one MS shipped object: sys.sp_MSfilterclause

Also, FASTFRISTROW comes back as appearing 90 times, however I could only find it as a comment in master.sys.sp_MSget_repl_commands – it appears in four distinct comments but never in the code.

item.title: By: Naila Khan
item.dc:creator: Naila Khan
item.content:encoded:
Thanks

I’ll make sure I wont use these functions anymore

Regards
Naila
